edu.harvard.iq.dvn.core.web.customComponent.scroller

Class ScrollerComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.faces.component.UIComponent
      • javax.faces.component.UIComponentBase
        • javax.faces.component.UICommand
          • edu.harvard.iq.dvn.core.web.customComponent.scroller.ScrollerComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, EventListener, javax.faces.component.ActionSource, javax.faces.component.ActionSource2, javax.faces.component.PartialStateHolder, javax.faces.component.StateHolder, javax.faces.event.ComponentSystemEventListener, javax.faces.event.FacesListener, javax.faces.event.SystemEventListenerHolder

    public class ScrollerComponent
extends javax.faces.component.UICommand
implements Serializable
    This component produces a search engine style scroller that facilitates easy navigation over results that span across several pages. It demonstrates how a component can do decoding and encoding without delegating it to a renderer.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getAnchorAttrs

        private String getAnchorAttrs(javax.faces.context.FacesContext context,
                    String clientId,
                    int action)

        Build and return the string consisting of the attibutes for a result set navigation link anchor.

        Parameters:
        context - the FacesContext
        clientId - the clientId of the enclosing UIComponent
        action - the value for the rhs of the =
        Returns:
        a String suitable for setting as the value of a navigation href.

      • getFormNumber

        protected int getFormNumber(javax.faces.context.FacesContext context)

      • getTotalPages

        protected int getTotalPages(javax.faces.context.FacesContext context)
        Returns the total number of pages in the result set based on rows and rowCount of UIData component that this scroller is associated with. For the purposes of this demo, we are assuming the UIData to be child of UIForm component and not nested inside a custom NamingContainer.

      • getRowsPerPage

        protected int getRowsPerPage(javax.faces.context.FacesContext context)
        Returns the number of rows to display by looking up the UIData component that this scroller is associated with. For the purposes of this demo, we are assuming the UIData to be child of UIForm component and not nested inside a custom NamingContainer.
